Wheat گندم

Content

  • Problems and Opportunities
  • Overview
  • Market Information
  • Photo Gallery
  • Links

Problems and Opportunities

  • Priority problems of wheat relate to seed quality and improved varieties, water management and the Moroccan Locust. Seedbeds (good seed-soil contact) and grain storage also need improvement.
  • Priority opportunities include working with organizations like FAO, MAIL and CIMMYT to access good seed, improve fertilizer use, and improve irrigation systems. The icon video Purdue PIC bag or the IRRI Super Bag may be good options for seed and grain storage.
  • Problems and opportunities from Hussain Sharifi.

Pest Management

Disease

  • UG 99 is a new (potentially devastating) race of the disease stem rust. UG 99-resistant wheat varieties have been developed. Contact CIMMYT or FAO.

Insects

Moroccan Locust

Factsheet

For more information see FAO and Plantwise

Sunn Pest

Brochure

(ICARDA)

Postharvest

  • Dry seed to less than 14% moisture and clean, then use the IRRI Superbag Fact sheet (IRRI) or PIC bag icon videoVideo (Purdue)
